triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper develops and transfers a reinforcement learning controller for UAV disturbance rejection.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper studies sim-to-real transfer for an octorotor UAV control system.

triples.name: Autoencoder
triples.relevance: The paper applies a measurement autoencoder to analyze real flight data and quantify sim-to-real differences.

triples.name: Jensen-Shannon divergence
triples.relevance: The paper uses Jensen-Shannon divergence to compare measurement distributions between simulated and real flights.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper develops a disturbance rejection controller that must transfer from simulation to the real world.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: The core topic of the paper is transferring a reinforcement learning controller from simulation to real-world UAV flights.

triples.name: Recurrent neural network
triples.relevance: The paper applies neural networks as a state transition model to understand flight dynamics differences between simulation and reality.

triples.name: Aircraft flight control system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses attitude control of a UAV, which relies on flight control principles.

triples.name: Waypoint
triples.relevance: The paper identifies that real UAVs exhibit different flight behavior related to waypoint navigation compared to simulation.

triples.name: Robotics simulator
triples.relevance: The paper quantifies the sim-to-real gap by comparing controller performance in simulation versus real-world UAV flights.
